description: Proposed works: Demolition of the existing rear extensions, and the construction of a ground floor and first floor rear extension together with the construction of an outbuilding, the excavation of a basement including a sunken garden, alterations to the roof and alterations to the side and rear fenestration .
decision_conditions: The front lightwell, by reason of its detailed design and appearance, would result in an obtrusive form of development that would be out of keeping andwhich would not be typical of the street. The proposal and would, therefore, fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the conservation area. As such, the proposal is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach), D4 (Delivering good design), and HC1 (Heritage conservation and growth) of The London Plan (2021); policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) and LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020) and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2009).

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-e4353890-7fff-8124-45a0-338045758dbe"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.28;text-align: justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:6pt;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The proposed first floor extension, by reason of its detailed design, in particular, its size,&nbsp; scale proportions and excessive amount of glazing, is considered to be an inappropriate and unsympathetic addition to the property that is out of keeping with the host building and surrounding development. The proposal fails to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the conservation area, contrary to policies D3, D4, and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies LP1 and LP3 of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020) and Hackney's Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2009).</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-12f287ee-7fff-7a55-2d9e-586db1059799"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.28;text-align: justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:6pt;padding:0pt 5pt 0pt 5pt;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The roof lights and alterations to the windows, by reason of their detailed design,&nbsp; appearance, and location, would be an obtrusive form of development that would be out of keeping and would fail to respect the character of the host property and surrounding development. The proposal would fail</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;"> to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the conservation area.</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;"> As such, the proposal is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach), D4 (Delivering good design), and HC1 (Heritage conservation and growth) of The London Plan (2021); policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) and LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020) and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2009).&nbsp;</span></p>
